column2: margin-bottom: 2"><b><font color="#336600" size="5" face="Arial"><i><span style="text-transform: uppercase">Rationale

column1: <td width="531" height="40"><font face="Arial" color="#336600" size="2">Arable land on slopes is marginally suitable for conventional farming. Yield losses from drought and high temperatures and other extremes can be in excess of 30 %. Land use planning and policies need to consider the climatic and physical impacts on bio-physical processes.&nbsp
We, therefore, define Agro-ecological indicators (AEI) as site-crop
<b> specific biophysical indices and their probability of occurrence in multiple process-simulation

at different degrees of aggregation (see figure). AEIs are related to topographic, climatic and management variables and generated using process-models for micro-meteorology and soil-plant-atmosphere interaction.
